intro: Angelica cartilaginomarginata var. cartilaginomarginata, commonly known as the cartilaginous-margin angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant is distinguished by its thick, fleshy leaves with a distinctive cartilaginous margin, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring cool and moist conditions. The flowers are small and white to greenish, arranged in compound umbels, and the plant is known for its strong, spicy scent.
